body: Where have you been OMG! I was making my own dog food but with a bad back it was harder and harder to do. All that work and the dogs would or wouldn’t eat it. I have two small dogs, one with extreme allergies and one diva. I started feeding them a duck flavor wet food but it got a little expensive. I had a bag of dry dog food that I started to mix in with the wet to use less wet food to save money. They went for it for the most part. When I ran out I tried the dry food my vet gave me for sensitive stomachs. That produced another problem, it was too big for the one dog to eat. He had got a piece of the dry food caught between his teeth that I had to remove. So anyway I’ve been looking for a lamb flavored dog food for small bites ever since. Got this yesterday and was impressed by how small the kibble was, perfect! Both dogs ate their food and didn’t leave any crunchy bits on the floor for me to step on. My dogs are the only two things I have going for me and I stress constantly about them, if they are happy, sad, bored or sick. I know it sounds ridiculous but this food put a smile on all three of our faces and a weight of my chest. Thank you!

body: Something was definitely off about my last bag My dogs have eaten science diet since birth the oldest has been on it for 10 years and the youngest for 6. But when I started giving them this particular bag of food something was off The oldest started defecating every where which was unlike her as she has been wee wee pads trained since she was one. I figured maybe it was old age a week later she started sleeping all the time and couldn't even climb the stairs. I still assumed old age but  that's when having tremors started, every time she had to go to the bathroom she would come to me scared. I immediately took it to the vet where they did an x-ray and blood work to see if she had blockage or infection cause she had a fever. everything came back good but two days later my youngest started having tremors too and cryed for what seemed like hours and hid under the bed all day trying to go to the bathroom. I immediately put two and two together old age for one but not both it had to be the one common thing the food . I Immediately called the vet and he said swap their food out for a new bag and they started getting better a day or so later he was back to normal but she still seems scared to go to the potty a month later. So pet parents please be careful and keep an eye on your pet buying these food on here.I contacted both amazon and science diet so they are aware of what happened.

body: One of the Best Science Diet honors the term "science."  More protein does not equal better for dogs because dogs are not Carnivores, and too much protein can lead to renal failure and cardiomyopathy.  Science Diet meets AAFCO standards, and my dog (Chiweenie) has a perfect coat and has perfect vitals and bloodwork.  It is more expensive than most dog foods, but you get what you pay for.  If you have the means, Science Diet is one of the best.  On that note, there are WAY more expensive dog foods of worse (and even dangerous) quality, so if you want the best, this is one of the top three or four products on the market in my opinion.  I've had nothing but great results with it.

body: Excellent Quality - Healthy Alternative to Grain-Free A few months ago I learned that Grain-free diets are known to cause serious heart issues, particularly in many small dog breeds, and the FDA has issued a warning against using them. After confirming the seriousness of the heart issues with my vet, I knew we had to switch our little Italian greyhound mix to a grain inclusive kibble.In the beginning I was worried because we were having a difficult time finding a dry food that our dog would eat but also wouldn’t cause her to scratch at herself due to excessive corn & fillers, etc.  After a few failed tries with other brands, we found Hill’s Science Diet.My dog loves this food! She is 13-lbs and the “little bites” are the perfect size for her to chew. Her coat is soft and shiny and her 💩 is on a healthy schedule. Both my vet and I agreed that Science Diet is a good, trustworthy brand and it’s proven to be the ideal solution for our problem.I’d highly recommend this food to any health-conscious dog owner.PS:  The smell of this food is pretty bad, but but since it comes in a handy Velcro/zip close bag that is resealable, does it matter?
